intro: Heleniastrum tenuifolium, commonly known as slenderleaf helenea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its slender, linear leaves are arranged along the stem, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in the summer. Heleniastrum tenuifolium is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
